revised_title: Evolution of DNA Sequences in Escherichia Coli
tldr: This article discusses the evolution of DNA sequences in Escherichia coli, focusing on genetic variation, chromosomal genes, and plasmids. The study reveals that natural populations of E. coli contain a large amount of genetic variation and multiple alleles at many loci. The article also explores the role of transposable elements in the evolution of bacterial DNA and their impact on genetic variation and gene expression.
